properly speaking of the Scolex-form of 
<u>Taenia solium<\u>, as well also with all that 
is known regarding the development of 
animals or plants, as to render what he 
says liable to the gravest suspicion 
that he has been entirely misled <s>over 
[text?]<\s> in his conceptions as to the true 
nature of the observed phenomena.
According to Mr Rainey the formation of the Cysticercus commences in the 
appearance within a muscular fasciculus 
of certain refractive granules, which 
gradually increase in number & are 
transformed into oblong cells. This 
granular or cellular mass becomes 
invested by a membrane, covered 
on the outer surface by a curious kind 
of setae or as he terms them cilia, to
